trans-unit.source: The <xref uid="langword_csharp_ComClassAttribute" name="ComClassAttribute" href=""></xref> attribute instructs the compiler to add metadata that allows a class to be exposed as a COM object.
Use `ComClassAttribute` to simplify the process of exposing COM components from Visual Basic.
COM objects are very different from .NET Framework assemblies; without the `ComClassAttribute`, you need to follow a number of steps to generate a COM object from Visual Basic.
For classes marked with `ComClassAttribute`, the compiler performs many of these steps automatically.
> [!NOTE] > This attribute simplifies the creation of COM objects.
To expose a class as a COM object, you must compile the project with the **Register for COM Interop** option selected in the **Build** section of the **Configuration Properties** dialog box.
> [!NOTE] > Although you can also expose a class created with Visual Basic as a COM object for unmanaged code to use, it is not a true COM object.
For details, see [COM Interoperability in .NET Framework Applications](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ComClassAttribute" name="ComClassAttribute" href=""></xref> class.
Use the constructor for the `ComClassAttribute` class to set the `ClassID`, `InterfaceID`, or `EventID` properties when applying the `ComClassAttribute` to a class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ComClassAttribute" name="ComClassAttribute" href=""></xref> class.
Use the constructor for the `ComClassAttribute` class to set the `ClassID`, `InterfaceID`, or `EventID` properties when applying the `ComClassAttribute` to a class.
Initializes the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ClassID" name="ClassID" href=""></xref> property that is used to uniquely identify a class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ComClassAttribute" name="ComClassAttribute" href=""></xref> class.
Use the constructor for the `ComClassAttribute` class to set the `ClassID`, `InterfaceID`, or `EventID` properties when applying the `ComClassAttribute` to a class.
Initializes the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ClassID" name="ClassID" href=""></xref> property that is used to uniquely identify a class.
Initializes the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_InterfaceID" name="InterfaceID" href=""></xref> property that is used to uniquely identify an interface.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ComClassAttribute" name="ComClassAttribute" href=""></xref> class.
Use the constructor for the `ComClassAttribute` class to set the `ClassID`, `InterfaceID`, or `EventID` properties when applying the `ComClassAttribute` to a class.
Initializes the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_ClassID" name="ClassID" href=""></xref> property that is used to uniquely identify a class.
Initializes the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_InterfaceID" name="InterfaceID" href=""></xref> property that is used to uniquely identify an interface.
Initializes the value of the <xref uid="langword_csharp_EventID" name="EventID" href=""></xref> property that is used to uniquely identify an event.
Gets a class ID used to uniquely identify a class.
The constructor sets this property when the `ComClassAttribute` is applied to a class.
Read-only.
A string that can be used by the compiler to uniquely identify the class when a COM object is created.
Gets an event ID used to uniquely identify an event.
The constructor sets this property when the `ComClassAttribute` is applied to a class.
Read only.
A string that can be used by the compiler to uniquely identify an event for the class when a COM object is created.
Gets an interface ID used to uniquely identify an interface.
The constructor sets this property when the `ComClassAttribute` is applied to a class.
Read-only.
A string that can be used by the compiler to uniquely identify an interface for the class when a COM object is created.
Indicates that the COM interface name shadows another member of the class or base class.
Shadowing is when a member uses the same name as another member.
A <xref uid="langword_csharp_Boolean" name="Boolean" href=""></xref> value that indicates that the COM interface name shadows another member of the class or base class.
